intro: Pseudostellaria terminalis, commonly known as the narrowleaf starwort, is a small flowering plant native to parts of Asia and North America. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae, which includes many other flowering plants with showy blooms. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges. Its leaves are narrow and linear, and it produces small, white or pinkish flowers in clusters at the ends of its stems. The species is often found in disturbed soils and is considered a characteristic plant of certain ecological communities.
